greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Cubefree part of n!.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
Rafael Jakimczuk, On the h-th free part of the factorial, International Mathematical Forum, Vol. 12, 2017, no. 13, 629-634.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Cubefree Part.
mathematica: CubefreePart[n_Integer?Positive] := Times @@ Power @@@ ({#[[1]], Mod[ #[[2]], 3]} & /@ FactorInteger[n]); Table[CubefreePart[n! ], {n, 1, 40}]
program: ....return 1 if n <=1 else reduce(mul,[p**(e % 3) for p,e in factorint(math.factorial(n)).items()])
(PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n!)); f[,2] = apply(x->(x % 3), f[,2]); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jan 06 2019
results.author: _Artur Jasinski_, Oct 15 2008
